articles.title: Pakistan to Argentina: 5 key elections across the world to watch out for in 2023
articles.description: Democracy is on the ballot in Nigeria, Turkey, Zimbabwe, Argentina and Pakistan this year. Common themes such as the handling of inflation and corruption may determine how incumbent governments and presidents fare at the ballot box
articles.content:
Predicting the outcome of national elections can be a mug’s game. Polls are often wrong, and second-guessing how people will vote months down the line can leave even the most savvy election specialist with egg on their face.

articles.title: 16 yellow cards, two reds: Mateu Lahoz, who showed 18 cards during the Argentina-Netherlands World Cup match lights up Barcelona-Espanyol La Liga meet
articles.description: While seven of Barcelona players were booked, including left back Jordi Alba being sent off, six Espanyol also had their names written by the Spanish ref that included Vinicius Souza receiving two yellows and eventually a red.
articles.content:
15 yellow cards. Two reds. A manager booked. Referee Antonio Mateu Lahoz lived up to his reputation as he officiated the Barcelona-Espanyol La Liga contest that ended in a chaotic 1-1 draw on Saturday, December 31.

articles.title: Lionel Messi's Argentine Salvation: Of Tears, Jeers and Celestial Providence
articles.description: A few years ago, mouths across Argentina murmured as hearts around the Rio de la Plata felt the fabled Argentine jersey weighed too heavily on the shoulders of the little genius. But, all that seems like a distant memory after Messi's World Cup heroics in Qatar
articles.content:
As improbable as it sounds right now, there was a time when the football-mad Argentine populace felt rather indifferent towards one of their biggest-ever products, Lionel Messi.
All that seems like a faint shade of a distant lucid dream as close to f... [12007 chars]

articles.content: A week has passed since the World Cup final in Qatar, which saw Messi’s Argentina win on penalties over Mbappé’s France. However, the controversy does not subside, with the Argentines asking the transalpines to “stop crying” for the result. South Ame... [2057 chars]

articles.title: United Cup: Croatia Beat Argentina as Petra Martic Rallies Past Nadia Podoroska
articles.description: Croatia notched up an unassailable 3-0 lead over Argentina at the United Cup on Sunday as Martic registered a 6-2, 4-6, 6-1 win over Podoroska
articles.content:
Petra Martic notched a 6-2, 4-6, 6-1 win over Nadia Podoroska to give Croatia an unassailable 3-0 lead over Argentina at the United Cup on Sunday.

articles.title: Argentine tattooists swamped by demand for Messi tributes
articles.description: Since Argentina's World Cup win turned Buenos Aires into a massive street party, tattoo artists have been hard at work inking the image of Lionel Messi on the bodies of fans paying tribute to the man who has come to rival the legend of the country's other soccer god, Diego Maradona.

articles.title: Amul Girl - Marketing icon-turned-social media darling who has an opinion on everything
articles.description: From commenting on the release of the latest films, including the Hollywood blockbuster Avatar, to Argentina winning the FIFA World Cup final, there is nowhere the Amul Girl doesn’t fit.
articles.content: New Delhi: After cartoonist R.K. Laxman’s ‘The Common Man’, it’s the Amul Girl who has tied herself to the Indian cultural landscape. A ubiquitous presence in every household, the enduring legacy of the Amul Girl exists in her adaptability. She is se... [4905 chars]
